body_content.explanation: a type of motorsport in which drivers compete to see who is the fastest on a route which goes up a hill:
examples: Cars from 1895 to the present day do a bit of hill climbing in front of 150,000 spectators.
This season there's a flurry of new, front-running cars using engines never seen in hillclimbing before.

body_content.explanation: a sport in which cyclists (= people riding bicycles) compete to see who is the fastest on a route which goes up a hill:
examples: Altogether, he won nearly 300 cycle racing prizes for road, track and hill climbing.
Hill climbing is a uniquely British form of time-trialling.

body_content.explanation: the activity of walking for pleasure in areas with a lot of hills:
examples: What followed were many happy years with her beloved husband walking and hill climbing.
Even though it was cool with a nice breeze, the hill climbing took its toll on us.

body_content.explanation: a mathematical method used for solving difficult problems that have several possible solutions by repeatedly improving previous solutions:
examples: One successful approach makes use of a hill climbing approach by swapping those two entries that make the strongest progress towards minimising the penalty.
Optimization approaches include hill climbing, stochastic search, directed stochastic search, and hybrid methods.
